title: Why Prince Harry's tour wardrobe has marked a new era for royal men's style
text:
It’s a hard act to follow: the style of royal men on official tours has always been nothing short of exceptional over the decades.

There’s the Duke of Edinburgh, magisterial and ever appropriate, in white naval uniform on a tour of Brazil in the Sixties, and the Prince of Wales in a pristine safari suit in Papua New Guinea in the early Eighties.

And while most eyes have been on the Duchess of Sussex and baby Archie this week, Prince Harry’s wardrobe choices on the young family’s tour of Africa, which wraps up today in a blaze of publicity after he published an essay criticizing the press on the couple's website, are telling in their relaxing of the rules (to varying degrees of success).

The Duke...
